item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Edmund Wilson
item.description: "There is nothing more demoralizing than a small but adequate income." -- Edmund Wilson

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Arthur Koestler
item.description: "Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion. " -- Arthur Koestler

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All the war-propaganda, all the screaming and lies and hatred, comes invariably from people who are not fighting." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jaron Lanier
item.description: "A real friendship ought to introduce each person to unexpected weirdness in the other." -- Jaron Lanier

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jaron Lanier
item.description: "Our willingness to suffer for the sake of the perception of freedom is remarkable." -- Jaron Lanier

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by John Jeremiah Sullivan
item.description: "We live in such constant nearness to the abyss of past time that the moment is endlessly sucked into." -- John Jeremiah Sullivan

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Robert Ardrey
item.description: "What we call patriotism, in other words, is a calculable force which, released by a predictable situation, will animate man in a manner no different from other territorial species." -- Robert Ardrey

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The Victorian Age, for all its humbug, was a period of rapid progress, because men were dominated by hope rather than fear. If we are again to have progress, we must again be dominated by hope." -- Bertrand Russell
